  • class GMSGfxData

Detailed Description

The original implementation of the GfxData.

Store allmost all information in stl-arrays. Can have 2^16 polygons with infinite number of coordinates in each. Have a precalculated BoundingBox and one length per polygon. But only one attribut for closed.

coordinate_type GfxDataFull::getMaxLon (   )  const [virtual]
 

Get the maximum longitude.

We have to remember that minLon can be < maxLon if we are close to London or Paris. So take care when using this function.

Returns:
The maximum longitude for the bounded box for this gfxData.

Implements GfxData.

bool GfxDataFull::getMC2BoundingBox (  MC2BoundingBox &  bb,
uint16  p = MAX_UINT16
)  const [virtual]
 

Fills in the supplied bbox.

Fast in this class (if p=MAX_UINT16) slow in the ones who do not have bounding boxes.

Reimplemented from GfxData.

void GfxDataFull::removeDeadEndCoordinates (   ) 
 

Removes dead-end coordinates from the gfxData.

Dead-end coordinates are such, that are in the gfxData of closed polygons but are not on the gfx-border.

bool GfxDataFull::sortPolygons (   )  [virtual]
 

Sort the polygons by the number of coordinates they have.

The polygon with the most number coordinates are set to polygon with index 0.

Returns:
True if the polygons are sorted, false otherwise.

Implements GfxData.
